memberdef.name: RING_BUFFER_SIZE_ASSERT_MSG
memberdef.initializer: "Size too big, if it is the ring buffer test check custom max size"

memberdef.name: RING_BUF_ITEM_DECLARE_POW2
memberdef.initializer: BUILD_ASSERT((1 << pow) < RING_BUFFER_MAX_SIZE,\ RING_BUFFER_SIZE_ASSERT_MSG); \ static uint32_t __noinit _ring_buffer_data_##name[BIT(pow)]; \ struct ring_buf name = { \ .size = (BIT(pow)), \ .mask = (BIT(pow)) - 1, \ .buf = { .buf32 = _ring_buffer_data_##name } \ }

briefdescription.para: Define and initialize a high performance ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This macro establishes a ring buffer whose size must be a power of 2; that is, the ring buffer contains 2^pow 32-bit words, where pow is the specified ring buffer size exponent. A high performance ring buffer doesn't require the use of modulo arithmetic operations to maintain itself.
The ring buffer can be accessed outside the module where it is defined using:

memberdef.name: RING_BUF_ITEM_DECLARE_SIZE
memberdef.initializer: BUILD_ASSERT(size32 < RING_BUFFER_MAX_SIZE,\ RING_BUFFER_SIZE_ASSERT_MSG); \ static uint32_t __noinit _ring_buffer_data_##name[size32]; \ struct ring_buf name = { \ .size = size32, \ .buf = { .buf32 = _ring_buffer_data_##name} \ }

briefdescription.para: Define and initialize a standard ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This macro establishes a ring buffer of an arbitrary size. A standard ring buffer uses modulo arithmetic operations to maintain itself.
The ring buffer can be accessed outside the module where it is defined using:

memberdef.name: RING_BUF_DECLARE
memberdef.initializer: BUILD_ASSERT(size8 < RING_BUFFER_MAX_SIZE,\ RING_BUFFER_SIZE_ASSERT_MSG); \ static uint8_t __noinit _ring_buffer_data_##name[size8]; \ struct ring_buf name = { \ .size = size8, \ .buf = { .buf8 = _ring_buffer_data_##name} \ }

briefdescription.para: Define and initialize a ring buffer for byte data.

detaileddescription.para: This macro establishes a ring buffer of an arbitrary size.
The ring buffer can be accessed outside the module where it is defined using:
This routine initializes a ring buffer, prior to its first use. It is only used for ring buffers not defined using RING_BUF_DECLARE, RING_BUF_ITEM_DECLARE_POW2 or RING_BUF_ITEM_DECLARE_SIZE.
Setting size to a power of 2 establishes a high performance ring buffer that doesn't require the use of modulo arithmetic operations to maintain itself.

parameterdescription.para: Ring buffer size (in 32-bit words or bytes).
Ring buffer data area (uint32_t data[size] or uint8_t data[size] for bytes mode).

briefdescription.para: Determine if a ring buffer is empty.

simplesect.para: 1 if the ring buffer is empty, or 0 if not.

briefdescription.para: Determine free space in a ring buffer.

simplesect.para: Ring buffer free space (in 32-bit words or bytes).
Ring buffer capacity (in 32-bit words or bytes).

briefdescription.para: Determine used space in a ring buffer.

simplesect.para: Ring buffer space used (in 32-bit words or bytes).

memberdef.argsstring: (struct ring_buf *buf, uint16_t type, uint8_t value, uint32_t *data, uint8_t size32)
memberdef.name: ring_buf_item_put

briefdescription.para: Write a data item to a ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This routine writes a data item to ring buffer buf. The data item is an array of 32-bit words (from zero to 1020 bytes in length), coupled with a 16-bit type identifier and an 8-bit integer value.

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple writers to the ring buffer must prevent concurrent write operations, either by preventing all writers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern writes to the ring buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Ring buffer has insufficient free space.

briefdescription.para: Read a data item from a ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This routine reads a data item from ring buffer buf. The data item is an array of 32-bit words (up to 1020 bytes in length), coupled with a 16-bit type identifier and an 8-bit integer value.

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple reads of the ring buffer must prevent concurrent read operations, either by preventing all readers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern reads to the ring buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Area to store the data item's type identifier.
Area to store the data item's integer value.
Area to store the data item. Can be NULL to discard data.
Size of the data item storage area (number of 32-bit chunks).
Data item was fetched; size32 now contains the number of 32-bit words read into data area data.
Data area data is too small; size32 now contains the number of 32-bit words needed.

briefdescription.para: Allocate buffer for writing data to a ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: With this routine, memory copying can be reduced since internal ring buffer can be used directly by the user. Once data is written to allocated area number of bytes written can be confirmed (see ring_buf_put_finish).

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple writers to the ring buffer must prevent concurrent write operations, either by preventing all writers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern writes to the ring buffer.
Ring buffer instance should not mix byte access and item access (calls prefixed with ring_buf_item_).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the address. It is set to a location within ring buffer.

simplesect.para: Size of allocated buffer which can be smaller than requested if there is not enough free space or buffer wraps.

briefdescription.para: Indicate number of bytes written to allocated buffers.

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple writers to the ring buffer must prevent concurrent write operations, either by preventing all writers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern writes to the ring buffer.
Ring buffer instance should not mix byte access and item access (calls prefixed with ring_buf_item_).

parameterdescription.para: Number of valid bytes in the allocated buffers.
Provided size exceeds free space in the ring buffer.

briefdescription.para: Write (copy) data to a ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This routine writes data to a ring buffer buf.

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple writers to the ring buffer must prevent concurrent write operations, either by preventing all writers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern writes to the ring buffer.
Ring buffer instance should not mix byte access and item access (calls prefixed with ring_buf_item_).

briefdescription.para: Get address of a valid data in a ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: With this routine, memory copying can be reduced since internal ring buffer can be used directly by the user. Once data is processed it can be freed using ring_buf_get_finish.

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple reads of the ring buffer must prevent concurrent read operations, either by preventing all readers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern reads to the ring buffer.
Ring buffer instance should not mix byte access and item access (calls prefixed with ring_buf_item_).

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the address. It is set to a location within ring buffer.

simplesect.para: Number of valid bytes in the provided buffer which can be smaller than requested if there is not enough free space or buffer wraps.

briefdescription.para: Indicate number of bytes read from claimed buffer.

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple reads of the ring buffer must prevent concurrent read operations, either by preventing all readers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern reads to the ring buffer.
Ring buffer instance should not mix byte access and item mode (calls prefixed with ring_buf_item_).

parameterdescription.para: Number of bytes that can be freed.
Provided size exceeds valid bytes in the ring buffer.

briefdescription.para: Read data from a ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This routine reads data from a ring buffer buf.

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple reads of the ring buffer must prevent concurrent read operations, either by preventing all readers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern reads to the ring buffer.
Ring buffer instance should not mix byte access and item mode (calls prefixed with ring_buf_item_).

parameterdescription.para: Address of the output buffer. Can be NULL to discard data.
of bytes written to the output buffer.

briefdescription.para: Peek at data from a ring buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This routine reads data from a ring buffer buf without removal.

simplesect.para: Use cases involving multiple reads of the ring buffer must prevent concurrent read operations, either by preventing all readers from being preempted or by using a mutex to govern reads to the ring buffer.
Ring buffer instance should not mix byte access and item mode (calls prefixed with ring_buf_item_).
Multiple calls to peek will result in the same data being 'peeked' multiple times. To remove data, use either ring_buf_get or ring_buf_get_claim followed by ring_buf_get_finish with a non-zero size.

parameterdescription.para: Address of the output buffer. Cannot be NULL.
of bytes written to the output buffer.
